main event: An airman at Elmendorf Air Force Base in Alaska observed a round, reddish object emitting spurts of thin gas over the airfield on October 1, 1952. The sighting lasted approximately 15 minutes and photographs were taken.
interesting points: The object was first seen northwest of the intersection of two main runways at Elmendorf Air Force Base before traveling in a southeasterly direction.
The object emitted short spurts of thin gas at short intervals, as observed by the airman.
The sighting occurred in poor visibility due to light snow and rain.
The report was improperly classified as a previous exhibit, indicating possible mishandling of UFO reports.
The conclusion of the investigation labeled the object as 'Unidentified' and 'Probably Balloon', highlighting the unknown nature of the sighting.
sighted object: round, reddish object emitting thin gas
witnesses: Airman Second Class John E Driscoll
